intro: Justicia elegantula, commonly known as the silverleaf justicia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom throughout the summer months. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its attractive foliage and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to native plant landscapes.
